data.title: St. Lawrence Mission Church in Heber City
data.meta_description: St. Lawrence Church in Heber City is a mission of St. Mary's Church, bringing the Body and Blood of Jesus Christ to the Heber Valley.
data.text:
THE ASSUMPTION OF MARY - ST. LAWRENCE MASS SCHEDULE

HOLYDAY OF OBLIGATION (AUGUST 15)

Thu, 8/15 at 9:30 AM - English

Thu, 8/15 at 6:00 PM - Spanish

For Mass times at St. Mary's, please click HERE.

give now sign up for updates

CHILDREN'S FAITH FORMATION

Faith Formation is a life-long process. St. Lawrence offers formal faith formation for the children of our Church from Kindergarten through 9th grade with curriculum that is grade specific.

This program is not exclusively a sacrament preparation program; it is only one component of your child's faith formation. Your child is not fully formed in their faith by only attending Sacrament Preparation.

If you have any questions, please contact DRE Andreina Payan at andreina.stlawrence@gmail.com.

Andreina's office hours are:

MON: 10 AM - 1 PM

TUE: 10 AM - 1 PM

FRI: 10 AM - 1 PM

Registration for the 2024-25 St. Lawrence Religious Ed year is now open! Classes will begin on September 29. Please register your children by filling out the form in the back of the church or found below and placing it in the drop-off box in the church. Religious Ed is free though donations are encouraged to support this important mission. Thank you!

Class dates CONFIRMATION CALENDAR (YEAR 1)

NIGHT AT THE MISSION

Night at the Mission: Join us at St. Lawrence once a month to hear a guest speaker and socialize. Please bring an appetizer, dessert, or drink to share.

Thursday, July 25th at 6:30 PM with Devin Halford.

“Encountering and Loving the ‘Least’ Among Us”

We all know the experience. We see the homeless man or woman on the street, by the store door, or in the same room as us—and we panic, or ignore, or become irritated. But deep down we all know that we would love to help that man or woman. Well, how? There’s no one-size-fit answer to it all. But perhaps there’s an approach we easily overlook or have never thought of. Come and listen to Devin Halford’s story of the past two years, of becoming friends with the homeless in Denver and Philadelphia. Come and see how the apostolate he served for addresses poverty and how you can integrate some of the approach into your everyday life. Note: Due to the church painting, the talk and social gathering will be held at St. Lawrence downstairs in the large classroom.

KNIGHTS OF COLUMBUS

Interested in the Knights of Columbus? Join local knights for their monthly meeting at St. Lawrence. Knights meet at 6:30 PM every third Wednesday of the month.

MUSICIANS, CANTORS, AND LITURGICAL MINISTERS

Can you carry a tune or play an instrument? Then the choir needs you! Both the Saturday evening 5:00 PM Mass and the Sunday 10:00 AM Mass are seeking additional members. Those interested should contact Christina Hemphill at (303)-881-3547. Thank you. St. Lawrence is also recruiting again for Eucharistic Ministers and Lectors. Those interested should contact Rachel LeMelle at rachel.stlawrence@gmail.com.
